cnbc.title: Alphabet calls out new AI-related risks, as it taps debt market to fund build-out
cnbc.summary: In Alphabet's annual report, the company said AI poses business risks, including its potential impact on advertising.

cnbc.title: Target steps up investment in store staffing, cuts about 500 other roles to help fix customer experience
cnbc.summary: The big-box retailer is trying to win back shoppers who have complained about sloppier stores, out-of-stock items and longer checkout lines.

cnbc.title: Oracle gains 9%, Microsoft climbs 3% as tech tries to bounce back from $1 trillion sell-off
cnbc.summary: AI hyperscalers had a bruising week after investors got jittery about huge expenditure outlooks.

cnbc.title: Tulsi Gabbard to testify at Senate Intelligence Committee amid election probe concerns
cnbc.summary: Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard has said she was at a Georgia election center during an FBI raid at the direction of President Trump.

cnbc.title: Databricks completes $5 billion funding round at $134 billion valuation
cnbc.summary: Databricks is prepared to go public "when the time is right," CEO and co-founder Ali Ghodsi told CNBC in an interview.

cnbc.title: FDA says Novo Nordisk's TV ad for obesity pill includes 'false or misleading' claims
cnbc.summary: The FDA requested that Novo take immediate action to address the violations, which could include ceasing all ads containing misleading claims about the pill.

cnbc.title: Housing affordability package set to advance in Congress amid home-cost concerns
cnbc.summary: Wide-ranging legislation would reduce regulations for homebuilders while giving local governments incentives to streamline the building process.

cnbc.title: Cuba says international airlines can no longer refuel there as Trump turns up the pressure
cnbc.summary: The update comes shortly after President Donald Trump threatened tariffs on any country that supplies Cuba with oil.

cnbc.title: Epstein's Silicon Valley connections went beyond Gates and Musk
cnbc.summary: The new Epstein files released by the DOJ show that the deceased financier was able to build relationships across Silicon Valley, from Bill Gates to Peter Thiel.

cnbc.title: AppLovin's stock pops 14% after short seller CapitalWatch apologizes, retracts report on shareholder
cnbc.summary: CapitalWatch wrote that its report linking AppLovin shareholder Hao Tang and criminal syndicates was inaccurate.
